vignette.name: Automatic buffer~ and fluid.dataset~ management
vignette.p: The buffer~ and fluid.dataset~ objects are essential components for dealing with data in the Fluid Corpus Manipulation Toolkit. Typically, we create instances of these objects as containers for storing data input and output. Overall, this makes the language of the toolkit verbose; at any stage you can probe data that is being created. However, it can be an exhausting pattern, particularly as you gain fluency in using and connecting the objects into pipelines of objects and you know what you want to do.

To address this interface friction, the toolkit offers the possibility of automatically managed buffer~ and fluid.dataset~ objects. These objects are created as needed, rather than at each stage of a processing pipeline, simplifying much of the workflow around analysis and data transformation.
The following set of patches explains how the toolkit handles buffer~ and fluid.dataset~ objects automatically for you as well as the caveats that you need to be aware of.
To start, it might be worth watching a video which briefly explains the concepts behind this interface. This video can be on the FluCoMa YouTube channel: https://youtu.be/2cbpSMON7ys
After that, we encourage you to explore this patch which demonstrates the interface.
